name: State_14

timeline_beats.label: Rebuilding after flux-era raids; formal Harbor Charter codified
Joined Coastal Defense Compact; fisheries treaty ratified

factions.label: Harbor Council
factions.influence_hint: administration, legal charter holders, medium influence

factions.label: Fisher-Guild Cooperative
factions.influence_hint: mass membership, controls quotas and seasonal labor

factions.label: Saltwrights & Shipwrights Union
factions.influence_hint: controls ship repair, saltworks, technical ritual workshops

factions.label: Harbor Guard (naval militia)
factions.influence_hint: security and enforcement, strong local arm

factions.label: Merchant Liturgical Houses
factions.influence_hint: trade-financing and ritual brokerage, external links

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Must honor alliance/treaty obligations listed in external_relations_refs
notes: High dependence on seasonal migratory fish and salted-catch exports
Ritual workshops require imported reagents; supply vulnerability affects ship repairs and auguries
Harbor Charter codifies fishing quotas; enforcement is a recurring domestic friction point
Membership in Coastal Defense Compact implies mutual defense patrol rotations
Pilot auguries commonly used for local guidance but legal requirement to carry charts and trained pilots
Storm surge and reef-shift risks shape settlement patterns and shipyard placement
Factions: recurring tensions between Harbor Council regulators and Fisher-Guild quota demands
